chunks.chunk_text: Hello 同情家族歡迎收聽Look Back Sunday在這個節目John老師會彙整過去不同國家與主題的熱門跟讀文章讓你可以在15分鐘內吸收最精華的世界時事趣聞Let's get right to it
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: In an observational study
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: The team also investigated whether certain drinking patterns, beverage types, and other health conditions made a difference to the impact of alcohol on brain healthNext article
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: Scientists have taught bees to smell the coronavirusScientists in the Netherlands have trained bees to identify COVID-19 through their sense of smell according to a press release from Wageningen UniversityThe research was conducted on more than 150 bees in Wageningen University's bio-veterinarian research laboratoryThe scientists trained
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: the bees by giving them a treat, a sugar water solution, every time they were exposed to the scent of a mink infected with COVID-19Each time the bees were exposed to a non-infected sample, they wouldn't get a rewardEventually, the bees could identify an infected sample within a few seconds and would then stick out their tongues like clockwork to collect the sugar water
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: These aren't the first animals to detect COVID-19 by scentResearchers have also trained dogs to distinguish between positive and negative COVID-19 samples from human saliva or sweat with fairly high levels of accuracyNext article
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: 和提供免費旅遊的承諾之旅。
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: spanking may affect brain development in childrenspanking may affect a child's brain development in similar ways to more severe forms of violence according to a new study led by Harvard researchers
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: Recently in the journal Child Development builds on existing studies that show heightened activity in certain regions of the brains of children who experience abuse in response to threat cues.The group found that children who had been spanked had a greater neural response in multiple regions of the prefrontal cortex PFC.These areas of the brain respond to cues in the environment that tend to be
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: consequential such as a threat and may affect decision making and the processing of situations.According to the study's authors,corporal punishment has been linked to the development of mental health issues,anxiety,depression,behavioural problems and substance use disorders.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: If you are looking to maximize the amount of fat burnt in your next workout,think about having a coffee half an hour before you get started.As a new study suggests,it can make a significant difference to fat burning,especially later on in the day.Researchers found that 3mg of caffeine per kilogram of body weight can boost the rate of fat burning during aerobic exercise based on
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: results gathered from 15 male volunteers.The coffee dose was shown to increase maximal fat oxidation rate,MFO,a measure of how efficiently the body burns of fat,by an average of 10.7% in the morning and 29% in the afternoon.This is a study with a fairly small sample of participants,so it's important not to jump
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: to the conclusion,but the results are clear enough to suggest that there is some kind of association there.Next,studies shows boldness can be a business advantage.Men with shaved heads are perceived to be more masculine,dominant and in some cases to have greater leadership potential than those with longer locks or with thinning hair.According to a recent study
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: by the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School,some executives say the style makes them appear younger or at least make their age less evident and gives them more confidence than a combed over or monk-like pate.The study found that men with thinning hair were viewed as the least attractive and powerful of the bunch,a finding that tracks with other studies showing that people perceive
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json

chunks.chunk_text: men with typical male pattern baldness as older and less attractive.For those men,the solution could be as cheap and as simple as a shave.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 健康相關時事趣聞 2023 All about health.json
